content.html: I'm not annoyed by this bug, just mystified by how it happens: somehow, every time I add the sqlite amalgamation — sqlite.c and sqlite.h — to my @PlatformIO_Org project, it adds Doom as one of my dependencies. Easy to work around, but puzzling and also KIND OF HILARIOUS.
content.value: I'm not annoyed by this bug, just mystified by how it happens: somehow, every time I add the sqlite amalgamation — sqlite.c and sqlite.h — to my @PlatformIO_Org project, it adds Doom as one of my dependencies. Easy to work around, but puzzling and also KIND OF HILARIOUS.

photo.alt: Screenshot, platformio build log. “Scanning dependencies...Dependency Graph”, a bunch of actual dependences and “Doom @ 1.0”

content: I once worked on a binary that mysteriously contained a JavaScript interpreter, a Python interpreter, a PDF decoder, and Xlib. Tracked it down to a single log statement that was using a web-capable print library. Delete the log statement, delete the insanity. For a while, anyway.
